meanings.definition: To surpass in bravery or courage.
meanings.sent1: She tried to outbrave her fear of heights by climbing the small ladder.
meanings.sent2: The knight decided to outbrave the dragon and protect the village.
meanings.sent3: The little mouse tried to outbrave the cat by standing on its hind legs.
meanings.sent4: The firefighter outbraved the raging flames to save the trapped family.
meanings.sent5: The young hero outbraved all odds to rescue the princess from the evil sorcerer.

meanings.sent1: He dared to outbrave the strict teacher by questioning her rules.
meanings.sent2: The rebellious teenager decided to outbrave the school's dress code.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to outbrave the bird by stealing its food.
meanings.sent4: The fearless explorer outbraved the treacherous terrain to reach the hidden temple.
meanings.sent5: The brave pirate outbraved the stormy seas to find the legendary treasure.

meanings.definition: To outdo in bravery or courage.
meanings.sent1: The superhero managed to outbrave all other heroes in the epic battle.
meanings.sent2: The soldier wanted to outbrave his comrades in the daring rescue mission.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy tried to outbrave the older dogs by barking the loudest.
meanings.sent4: The young athlete outbraved his opponents in the final sprint of the race.
meanings.sent5: The brave astronaut outbraved the unknown dangers of space to explore new worlds.
